title: Big gaps in 911 response
description: An analysis of more than 70,000 calls shows disparities in response times across the Twin Cities.

title: Disappearing forests in Minnesota
description: Exploration and visualization of prediction models of biomes changing in Minesota.

title: Housing markets in the Twin Cities
description: Analysis of a decade of housing data across the Twin Cities metro area giving readers a complete picture and ranking of each market in the area.

title: How high school hockey in Minnesota has changed
description: Analysis of hundreds of thousands of penalties over almost a decade to show how the game has changed in Minnesota high school hockey.

title: Live midterm election results
description: 2018 live midterm election results powered by Associated Press and Minnesota Secretary of State via civix.

title: Denied Justice
description: Denied Justice was a powerful, multi-part series about sexual assult in Minnesota; I was tasked with building the front-end of the interactive video installment.

title: Minneapolis 2040 plan
description: How each parcel across Minneapolis will change under the proposed 2040 plan.

title: Top executives in Minnesota
description: List of the most compensated executives in Minnesota.

title: Minnesota election guide
description: Candidates positions for key races in state-level races in Minnesota..

title: Strib social card generator
description: A browser-based tool for creating images for social platforms.

title: Minnesota top businesses
description: A breakdown of the top 50 publicly-traded companies based in Minnesota.

title: Minnesota campaign finance in key races
description: An updating look at how money is flowing to candidates in key races in Minnesota.

title: Summer camp guide
description: An interactive, searchable database to help readers find summer camps for their kids and families.

title: Minnesota top non-profit 100
description: The top 100 non-profits in Minnesota.

title: Twin Cities election guide
description: Address-based lookup to figure out what is on the ballot in the Twin Cities.

title: Super Bowl guide
description: A progressive wbe app mini-site showcasing things to do and see in the Twin Cities for visitors that were in town for Super Bowl LII.

title: Ranked-choice explained
description: An updated visual explanation of how ranked-choice voting works.

title: Minnesota elections API
description: A command-line tool that turns data from the Minnesota Secretary of State into JSON files for use as a static API.

title: Beating the odds
description: Updating our predictive analysis of how schools may doing better than what is modeled based on free or reduced-price lunch in the school.

title: Mayoral calculus
description: A visual explanation of how the 2017 Minneapolis mayoral ranked-choice race was counted and how the winner was determined.

title: How land use has changed in the Twin Cities
description: Utilizing land use data and aerial imagery, I created these maps to how land use has change from 2010 to 2016 in the Twin Cities. The data analysis and mapping informed reporting on multiple stories.

title: Town halls
description: During the 2017 congressional recess, we tracked which representatives were having town hall meetings.

title: Where they stand
description: Working with reporters and devs at WNYC and NPR, we quickly surveyed all members of Congress on their stance concerning the travel ban, and created a simple interface to look up your representatives.

title: Harlem Heat
description: As part of the Harlem Heat multi-part series the data team created sensors to monitor the indoor temperature in Harlem that worked to inform reporting as well as data visualiztions and "audio-izations".

title: Landslide
description: For Electionland 2016, I created a small, lightweight interface to explore the firehose of multiple data sources that ElectionLand was gathering information from; this helped the volunteers and reports to triage quickly and get to the most relevant data they needed more efficiently.

title: tables
description: tables is a command-line utility aimed at making it easy to get tabular data, large or small, in multiple file formats into a database quickly, while still supporing edge cases and flexibility.

title: catalog-it
description: A command line utility, catalog-it provides functions to archive data catalogs. By using something like cron, catalog-it can watch and download and archive every dataset in a data-catalog when it changes, such as New York City's data portal. Currently only works with Socrata data portals.

title: MTA styles
description: A small CSS/SASS library for creating consistent MTA subway symbols and colors.

title: Locator
description: A browser-based locator map image creator, Locator use browser mapping technologies to allow a user to create custom locator maps, and allows organizations to deploy Locator in a way that is consistent with their organization.

title: Tik Tok
description: Tik Tok is a front-end library for creating, simple but elegant vertical timelines; designed to be easy but customizable to fit different needs.

title: Section 8
description: Working with reporters we analyzed and presented data that showed how those with housing choice vouchers were more likely to live in high poverty areas as well as mapping to show the growth and concentration of vouhcers.

title: Infomagical
description: As part of Infomagical, an engagement project around information overload, I built a back-end SMS system that interacted with 20k users and sent over 100k messages and images, all on a very tight deadline.

title: NJ toxic sites
description: After recieving information on every "contaminated site" within NJ, we analyzes who lived closest to these sites, and allowed listeners to find sites near where they lived or cared about.

title: Aurora Shanty
description: As part of the 2016 Art Shanty project, I led a team that built a northern-lights-inspired, solar-powered LED display inside a small shanty on a frozen lake for a month in the Minnesota winter.

title: Schoolbook
description: In 2016, we updated the popular SchoolBook website that provided an interface to easily search and compare schools in NYC.

title: Citi Bike deserts
description: After tracking data from the hundreds of Citi Bike stations, we were able to determine when and where there was consistent empty or full areas around the city.

title: Kittenbus
description: Working with young artists at Juxstaposition Arts, we created and installed a display near a downtown bus stop in Minneapolis, that showed custom, animated visualizations of buses arriving in real-time.

title: Pope visit
description: In 2015, Pope Francis visited New York City, so we turned the word-heavy advisory that the City provided into a map of what and when roads were closed during the visit to help commuters better plan.

title: Bike lane blockers
description: Asking listeners to submit their experiences and pictures, we created a map showing where cars, trucks, people, and may other things ended up blocking the bike lanes.

title: Metal detectors
description: Manually piecing together multiple datasets, we analyzed the schools that had metal detectors and what kind of students ended up going through them.

title: Illegal hotels
description: We did geospatial analysis of AirBnB listings and inpsections of "illegal hotels" in NYC.

title: Parks access
description: We analyzed parks and park access across NYC and found that though the numbers in aggregate are good, access could vary greatly across the city.

title: Determined Dill
description: As part of the first Minnesota Pickle Festival, I created this simple, browser jumper game in collaboration with Squawk.

title: NYC stock photos
description: Our team went out into the city and acted out typical situations one comes across in NYC; we then released the photos under a Creative Commons license on Flickr.

title: Ice cream radar
description: It was hot in NYC, so we made a map to help people to get to ice cream.

title: Subway agony
description: To help determine just how late trains were running across the MTA system, we regulary took snapshots of real-time train data to create the simplified, emoji-based "Subway Agony index".

title: NYC watershed
description: A visual explanaition of where NYC gets most of it's drinking water from.

title: Christieverse
description: In the wake of the George Washington Bridge lane closure, a.k.a. Bridgegate, we created an audio and visual walk through of the people involved and their relation to Governor Chris Christie.

title: Slack-enabled camera
description: An experiment in connecting Slack to a camera to help facilite remote work.

title: Speed cameras
description: After analyzing ticket locations across the city, our team could pinpoint where speeding cameras were and what kind of impact they had.

title: Outside spending
description: Working with our state political reporter, we visualized how money flowed through PACs on the Minnesota state level.

title: MN competitive House districts
description: Analysis and presentation of political leanings for all state House races in Minnesota.

title: Minneapolis zoning
description: A simple map visualization of zoning across the city of Minneapolis.

title: aRanger
description: A browser-based tool to help create custom cartogram layouts.

title: 20 races
description: A breakdown of the 20 most competitive races for the Minnesota State House.

title: Lacu
description: Lacu is a project we made for Northern Spark 2014 which visualizes 13,817 lakes in Minnesota, two at a time. Lacu ran from sun up to sun down, the span of the event. The plan was to project it on the front of the Northrup Auditorium, but due to weather, we projected it inside the building.

title: who lives on the green line
description: After the Green line opened, we visualized the demographics along the new transit line.

title: Journalism in code
description: Regularly collecting information from all the journalism organizations on Github, "journalism in code" shows what code is being written across these organizations.

title: Metro-area parcels
description: A map of every parcel in the most of the counties in the Twin Cities metro area.

title: County commissioner
description: An interactive questionnaire for helping readers narrow their selection for the Hennepin County Commissioner primary.

title: Normal temperatures
description: An hourly-updated look at how the temperatute today, the past week, the past month, and the current season in the Twin Cities compares to the 30-year normal.

title: Snow emergency locator
description: A mobile-friendly way to look up if you are parking on the right side of the road during a Snow Emergency in Minneapolis using browser-based location.

title: Lumière
description: Lumière is a personal project where anyone can change the colors of the holiday lights on our house. Designed to be reusable and extended, its architecture is flexible and well-documented.

title: Visualizing hazardous materials
description: A visual breakdown of all the hazmat incidents that occurred in Minnesota from 2000 to 2012.

title: Gettysburg address
description: A quiz-like interactive to test how well readers know the Gettysburg Address.

title: Totoro
description: An experimentation in how to represent the live estimated time of arrival for buses.

title: Live elections results
description: Live election results dashboard utilizing data from the Minnesota Secretary of State.

title: Minneapolis crime
description: Monthly interactive visual showing crime trends by neighborhoods in Minneapolis.

title: Tulip
description: A browser-based tool for creating simple choropleth maps.

title: Simple Map D3
description: A javascript, D3 libary for making simple choropleth maps in the browser.

title: Mapping fiber
description: Reporting and mapping on the spread of fiber-optic internet in Minneapolis.

title: What did they pass?
description: A visual look at what the Minnesota State Legislature passed in the 2013 session.

title: Legislature tracker
description: An interactive utilizing Open States to show how key bills are progressing through the Minnesota State Legislature.

title: Dayton's budget
description: A visual rundown of Governor Dayton's proposed budget.

title: Legislature scenarios
description: An exploration of how the Minnesota State Legislature might turn out after the election.

title: Invasive species
description: A map of all the reports of invasive species across Minnesota.

title: A Day in the Life of Nice Ride
description: An animated map showing bike-share trips across the city of Minneapolis.

title: Chronological
description: A personal project showcasing the places I have lived to the tune of an Astronautalis song.

title: Change by Us (Philly)
description: Change by Us is civic tool to gather and aggreagte feedback about community concerns.

title: HistoryNear.me
description: Explore historical sites in San Diego on this map.

title: Haiku and a Portrait
description: In 2009, I started the year with the thought that I would a take a self-portrait and write a haiku everyday. I did not make it more than a month, but the short time was enjoyable and I produced some decent work.
